content.description: Harder then The Girl and Receptionist but on par difficulty wise with Lolita. Shares the same opening moves as Lolita but climbs through a different section of the roof and finishes farther right. Last hard move is a big throw that goes off a left hand undercling and a right hand pocket to a big flat pocket on the headwall.
content.location: All the way at the back of the draw from the main parking lot. There's a parking lot on the other side of the draw that's way closer to mars. Maybe a 5 minute hike compared to a 30 minute hike from the main lot. Link to the closer parking lot goo.gl/maps/YZAfhVGa1Tt

content.description:
Start on the right side of the roof and finish through the receptionist.

 Video shows the start but finishes on Ipanema. youtube.com/watch?v=oFINnMY…

Crawl into the cave and begin at a wide pocket far back in the roof (starting feet out is acceptable.) Aiming for the obvious tufa pinch on the headwall, navigate the complex of pockets to an undercling and sloper at the lip. "Answer the phone" and square up for a heartbreaker throw to victory.
content.protection: Bring a few pads, the landing is mostly safe except for the awkward shelf under the start.
content.location: Main section of the Mars Roof, second problem from the left.

content.description: Start far right of the roof and exit through suplexing .

Start as Receptionist but climb right several feet then straight out the roof through pockets and fat   pinches to a difficult lip encounter. 

youtube.com/watch?v=lg5wAuc…

Start as per the Receptionist, and once you gain the heart-shaped box toe cam (critical for this line and the Receptionist) begin trending left. With increasing difficulty set up for a big leftwards, heartbreaking huck to a sidepull jug. From there climb up to the horizontal line of positive, but sloping, holds, and bust right to an easy(ish) finish.
content.location: Mars Roof. Any local will be happy to hose you down with a plethora of beta variations on this pocket jungle.

content.description: Climb The Girl to the horizontal line of jugs. After a short rest, bust left to the finger crack in the roof for a V4-5 finish to a jug at the lip. Most folks geek out their beta on the crack before giving it the old college try. The grade comes from this being a heartbreaking enduro-fest.
content.location: The crack exit is on the left side of Mars above a boulder.

content.description:
Start far right on the roof and exit through Ipanema.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oFINnMYv_X0
Far right start and exits through lolita.

The proudest feature at the Draw - a massive double roof with half a dozen problems. Four of them start in the same spot at the back of the lower roof and follow complex, sustained lines to distinct headwall finishes. The upper roof has a single problem through a funky seam. The Girl From Ipanema is the linkup of the two roofs.
